text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
HAARETZ
- U.S. envoy Ross threatens to return immediately to U.S. if meaningful progress not made in Israel, PLO negotiations.
- U.S. a month ago warned Israel: A freeze in peace talks with Syria could bring escalation and deterioration.
- Senior treasury officials: military industries has to lay off 500 more workers.
- Interior minister calls for bringing 4,000 more Ethiopian Jews to Israel "at one go".
JERUSALEM POST
- IDB Development buys Hapoalim's surplus stake in Clal for 137 million shekels ($45.6 million).
- Transportation minister says religious Jewish investors from U.S. offer to buy state airlines El Al running on a six-day a week basis due to the Jewish sabbath.
- Bank Leumi denies surrender to political dictate over appointment of new chairman for Africa-Israel.
MAARIV
- State witness aided in revealing Murdoch company case.
- Protests against Hebron redeployment begin to heat up.
- Prime Minister Netanyahu's office says French President Chirac will be received warmly.
YEDIOTH
- Israel rejects the French attempt to get involved in peace negotiations.
- Gathering of rightwing rabbis says Hebron redeployment is suicide; Hebrew University professor says danger to Netanyahu's life from Jewish extremists over the Hebron deal if implemented.
- Netanyahu turns 47 today.
- State airline El Al will fly to Europe on Jewish sabbath.
GLOBES
- Hindujas joins with Bezeq Telecommunications in India project.
